title: 820-00165 No backlight, Im stumped.
message:
Im getting a short every time I plug in the screen, my first suspect was Q7707, however I have already replaced it and everything measures correctly.  EDP_BKLT_EN is 3.2V, same with BKLT_PLT_RST, its at 3.2V as well.

When I plug in the screen LCDBKLT_EN_L gets 0V, and Q7706 gets shorted somehow. PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLTFET goes to 1V, on F7700, and on Q7706 (Pin 4) and R7788, R7789, and C7782.

By the way PPBUS_G3H is at 8.6V, but goes to 1V on PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLTFET

When the screen is unplugged I get 8.6V on F7700, and 8.6V on PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLTFET. Q7706 does not open of course but then there is 8V on LCDBKLT_EN_L.

Resistance of R7788 and R7789 are correct

I have already replaced C7782, Q7706 (Twice) and Q7707.

title: 820-00165 No backlight, Im stumped.
message:
Did you check diode mode at K/D7701 w/ and w/o LCD connected?

"By the way PPBUS_G3H is at 8.6V, but goes to 1V on PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLTFET"
Bad F7700.
How can you think a good fuse has different voltage on its pins?

"When the screen is unplugged...."
What you expect to get then?
Any voltage measured is nonsense in such case.

title: 820-00165 No backlight, Im stumped.
message:
F7700 turns to 8V (G3H and PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLTFET) when screen is unplugged. Its a changed fuse as well, and is not blown.

D7701 diode mode measures (red probe at ground)  measures 0.520V (without screen plugged in and with screen plugged in)

title: 820-00165 No backlight, Im stumped.
message:
Do you have same voltage on both pins of F7700, w/ and w/o LCD connected???

"D7701 diode mode..."
Which pin???
I was asking about its cathode...

title: 820-00165 No backlight, Im stumped.
message:
It was the fuse! You were right! It was trolling me, I normally measure if fuses are good or bad with resistance, however when i checked continuity through it, no beep, so thank you!

However another thing is wrong, I get backlight however on only half of the screen, tested on 2 good screens and both have the same issue. R7720 - R7722 both measure 0V when should be 14V correct? This has to be U7701 correct?

title: 820-00165 No backlight, Im stumped.
message:
"should be 14V"
Why do you suppose that???

Check if all return resistors are good and post diode mode to ground on them.

title: 820-00165 No backlight, Im stumped.
message:
On a working board it was 14V on LED Return. Replaced LP8550, works now.

Thanks!
